_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accident Release Prevention Program and Emergency Response Policy:

It is the policy of the Windsor Foods Carthage Missouri facility management to implement the requirements of this Risk Management program (RMP) in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40 CFR Part 68 and with the corresponding regulations under OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) program. The objective is to minimize the risk of a release of a hazardous material and if a release occurs, to minimize the potential impact to Windsor Foods employees, the public and the environment.This objective will be accomplished by utilizing general good operating procedures, providing appropriate training to all employees, and coordinating response activities, as necessary, with the local response providers. This plan covers all Windsor Foods owned activities at this facility.
Windsor Foods management is committed to providing the resources necessary to implement this policy



Facility Description: Windsor Foods operates a food processing facility at this location. Windsor Foods is a producer of breaded meats, oven cooked meatballs flame broiled meat patties, and breaded  vegetable  & cheese products. Support operations include cold storage, an analytical laboratory, and administrative offices.


Two chemicals are utilized at the facility in quantities to be subject to the requirements of 40 CFR Part 68. These chemicals are Ammonia and Propane. Ammonia is used as a refrigerant throughout the facility and propane fuel is used as a primary fuel supply for processing equipment and heating purposes. The worst case scenario for an anhydrous ammonia release included a release of all the contents of the high-pressure reciever in a ten minute period. The alternate-release scenario selected for the ammonia system  is a release from a relief valve due to overpressure of a condensing unit.The largest relief valve in the system was used in this scenario, with a relief rate of 57.6 pounds of air per minute. The worst

case scenario chosen for propane was a release of the entire contents of the tank, with an alternate release scenario involving a release from a 50'  2" line rupture.  The Carthage, Missouri facility is governed by a set of OSHA and USEPA regulations that require planning and facility activities intended to prevent a release of hazardous material, or if a release inadvertently occurs, to minimize the consequences of a release to the employees of the facility, the public, and the environment. The key concepts in Windsor Foods release prevention program are employee participation, appropriate design, and maintenance of equipment, and appropriate training of all employees. Windsor Foods has developed and documented these element in their process safety management plan (PSM).
